vyra_base.com.datalayer.callable module¶

class vyra_base.com.datalayer.callable.VyraCallable(name='', type=None, description='', last_return=None, service_server=None, connected_callback=None)¶

Bases: object

A class that represents and stores all information about a Vyra callable. A callable is a function that can be invoked with arguments and returns a result within a specified time limit. It is used to define quick responses to requests in the Vyra. :type name: str :param name: Name of the callable. :type type: Any :param type: Type of the callable, typically a ROS2 service type. :param

connected_callback: Optional[Callable] = None¶
description: str = ''¶
last_return: Any = None¶
merge(other)¶

Merge another Callable into this one, combining their attributes. :type other: Any :param other: Another Callable instance to merge with. :rtype: VyraCallable :return: A new Callable instance with merged attributes.

name: str = ''¶
service_server: Optional[VyraServiceServer] = None¶
type: Any = None¶

vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory module¶

class vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory.DataSpace¶

Bases: object

DataSpace is a class that represents a data space in the V.Y.R.A.. It is used to create and manage various types of data layers such as callables, jobs, observables, and speakers.

classmethod add_callable(obj)¶

Add an object to the DataSpace. This method will add the object to the appropriate list in the DataSpace.

Parameters:

obj (VyraCallable) – Add a V.Y.R.A. callable, job, or speaker to the DataSpace. If the object already exists, it will merge the new object with the existing one.

Return type:

VyraCallable

Returns:

None

classmethod add_job(obj)¶

Add an object to the DataSpace. This method will add the object to the appropriate list in the DataSpace.

Parameters:

obj (VyraJob) – Add a V.Y.R.A. callable, job, or speaker to the DataSpace. If the object already exists, it will merge the new object with the existing one.

Return type:

VyraJob

Returns:

None

classmethod add_speaker(obj)¶

Add an object to the DataSpace. This method will add the object to the appropriate list in the DataSpace.

Parameters:

obj (VyraSpeaker) – Add a V.Y.R.A. callable, job, or speaker to the DataSpace. If the object already exists, it will merge the new object with the existing one.

Return type:

VyraSpeaker

Returns:

None

callables: list[VyraCallable] = []¶
jobs: list[VyraJob] = []¶
classmethod kill(obj)¶

Kill a specific object in the DataSpace. This method will remove the object from the DataSpace and clean up any resources associated with it.

Parameters:

obj (Any) – Remove a V.Y.R.A. callable, job, or speaker from the DataSpace.

Return type:

None

Returns:

None

speakers: list[VyraSpeaker] = []¶
vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory.create_vyra_callable(name, type, node, callback=None, async_loop=None)¶

Create a callable for a V.Y.R.A. (V.Y.R.A. Operating System) service. A callable is a function that will give a very quick response to the request, and will not block the caller. A callable must return a value within a given time limit, otherwise it will be considered a failure.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the callable.

  • type (Any) – Containing the ros2 service datatype definition.

  • node (VyraNode) – Definition of the ros2 node.

  • callback (Optional[Callable]) – Callback function that will be called when the service is invoked.

  • parameters – Optional parameters of the callable that are needed.

  • callback – Optional callback function that will be called when the service is invoked. Better use the decorator @remote_callable to add a callable connected function.

Return type:

VyraCallable

Returns:

Callable that can be used to call the service.

vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory.create_vyra_job(name, type, async_loop=None)¶

Create a job for a V.Y.R.A. (V.Y.R.A. Operating System) service. A job is a function that will be executed in the background, and will not block the caller. A job can take a long time to complete, and will return a result when it is done. Beside the result, a job can also provide feedback information during the process, which can be used until the job is completed.

has completed, or has failed. :type name: str :param name: Name of the service., An observer is a subscription to a topic that will receive updates of simple data types. It is been used to watch variables of other variobotic os modules.

For example this could be used to watch the state of a robot, live coordinates of a camera, or the status of a sensor.

Parameters:

name – Name of the service.

Return type:

None

Returns:

Callable that can be used to watch the service.

vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory.create_vyra_speaker(name, type, node, description, periodic=False, interval_time=None, periodic_caller=None, qos_profile=10, async_loop=None)¶

Create a speaker for a V.Y.R.A. service. A speaker is a publisher that will send messages to a topic. It is used to publish simple data types to other variobotic os modules.

Parameters:

name (str) – Name of the service.

Return type:

VyraSpeaker

Returns:

Callable that can be used to shout to the service.

vyra_base.com.datalayer.interface_factory.remote_callable(func)¶

Decorator to register a function or method as a V.Y.R.A. callable.
